# Community Guidelines

These Community Guidelines outline the expectations for behavior and participation in the SynthFlow community. Our goal is to create a welcoming, inclusive, and productive environment for all members.

## Our Mission

SynthFlow aims to build a diverse and vibrant community of developers, researchers, and enthusiasts who collaborate to create innovative programming tools and advance the state of software development.

## Core Values

### Inclusivity
We welcome people of all backgrounds, experiences, and identities. Everyone should feel valued and respected in our community.

### Respect
We treat each other with courtesy and consideration, even when we disagree. Personal attacks and harassment are never acceptable.

### Collaboration
We work together to solve problems, share knowledge, and build better tools for everyone.

### Innovation
We encourage experimentation, creativity, and bold ideas that push the boundaries of what's possible.

### Growth
We support learning and development at all levels, from beginners to experts.

## Expected Behavior

### Be Welcoming
- Use inclusive language
- Be patient with newcomers
- Offer help to those who need it
- Make space for diverse perspectives

### Be Respectful
- Listen actively to others
- Disagree constructively
- Give credit where it's due
- Respect different viewpoints and experiences

### Be Collaborative
- Share knowledge freely
- Provide constructive feedback
- Acknowledge contributions
- Work together toward common goals

### Be Professional
- Maintain appropriate boundaries
- Keep discussions on topic
- Follow established processes
- Represent the community positively

## Unacceptable Behavior

### Harassment
- Offensive comments related to identity
- Sexual harassment or advances
- Stalking or following
- Sustained disruption of discussions

### Abuse
- Personal attacks or insults
- Threats of violence
- Intimidation or bullying
- Doxing (sharing private information)

### Discrimination
- Exclusionary behavior based on identity
- Bias in project participation
- Unequal treatment of contributors
- Preferential treatment based on relationships

### Disruption
- Trolling or inflammatory comments
- Spam or off-topic posting
- Excessive self-promotion
- Ignoring moderator requests

## Community Platforms

### GitHub
- Code reviews and contributions
- Issue tracking and bug reports
- Documentation improvements
- Feature discussions

### Discussion Forums
- General community discussions
- Help and support requests
- Project announcements
- Community events

### Social Media
- Project updates and news
- Community spotlights
- Educational content
- Event promotion

### Real-Time Chat
- Quick questions and answers
- Collaborative problem solving
- Community building
- Event coordination

## Reporting Issues

### When to Report
- Witnessing harassment or abuse
- Experiencing discrimination
- Observing disruptive behavior
- Having concerns about safety

### How to Report
1. Contact community moderators directly
2. Use platform-specific reporting tools
3. Email community@synthflow.ai
4. Reach out to project maintainers

### What Happens Next
- Reports are reviewed promptly
- Investigators gather information
- Appropriate action is taken
- Follow-up with reporting party

## Enforcement Actions

### Correction
- Private conversation about behavior
- Public reminder of guidelines
- Removal of inappropriate content
- Temporary posting restrictions

### Warning
- Formal written warning
- Temporary suspension from platforms
- Required education or training
- Supervision of future contributions

### Consequences
- Temporary ban from community
- Permanent removal from platforms
- Revocation of privileges
- Legal action if necessary

## Moderation

### Moderator Responsibilities
- Enforce community guidelines
- Facilitate healthy discussions
- Resolve conflicts constructively
- Support community members

### Becoming a Moderator
- Demonstrate consistent positive behavior
- Show commitment to community values
- Gain experience in community interactions
- Receive nomination from existing moderators

### Moderator Training
- Guidelines and procedures
- Conflict resolution techniques
- Bias recognition and mitigation
- Legal and ethical considerations

## Recognition and Rewards

### Contributor Recognition
- Highlighting significant contributions
- Featuring community members in newsletters
- Awarding digital badges and certificates
- Inviting to special events and programs

### Mentorship Programs
- Pairing experienced with new contributors
- Providing guidance and support
- Facilitating skill development
- Building professional relationships

### Community Events
- Virtual and in-person meetups
- Hackathons and coding challenges
- Educational workshops and tutorials
- Social gatherings and networking

## Educational Resources

### Learning Materials
- Tutorials and documentation
- Video courses and webinars
- Example projects and templates
- Best practices guides

### Skill Development
- Code review sessions
- Pair programming opportunities
- Technical mentoring
- Career development resources

## Diversity and Inclusion

### Outreach Programs
- Partnerships with educational institutions
- Collaboration with diversity organizations
- Scholarship and grant programs
- Community workshop series

### Accessibility
- Support for assistive technologies
- Accommodation for different needs
- Inclusive event planning
- Accessible documentation

## Conflict Resolution

### Addressing Disagreements
- Encourage respectful dialogue
- Focus on issues, not personalities
- Seek common ground
- Involve mediators when needed

### Escalation Process
- Direct communication between parties
- Involvement of community moderators
- Mediation by neutral third parties
- Formal review processes

## Community Health

### Metrics and Monitoring
- Participation rates and trends
- Diversity and inclusion measurements
- Conflict and resolution tracking
- Member satisfaction surveys

### Continuous Improvement
- Regular guideline reviews
- Feedback collection and analysis
- Process optimization
- Best practice adoption

## Special Interest Groups

### Formation Process
- Identify community interest
- Propose group charter
- Recruit initial members
- Establish communication channels

### Support Resources
- Dedicated meeting spaces
- Funding for activities
- Access to project resources
- Connection to broader community

## Code of Conduct Enforcement

### Investigation Process
- Initial assessment of reports
- Gathering of evidence and testimony
- Consultation with relevant parties
- Determination of appropriate action

### Appeal Process
- Right to contest decisions
- Review by different moderators
- Consideration of new evidence
- Final determination by project leads

## Community Leadership

### Roles and Responsibilities
- Project maintainers
- Community moderators
- Special interest group leaders
- Event organizers

### Leadership Development
- Training and mentoring programs
- Succession planning
- Leadership skill development
- Recognition of leadership contributions

## Feedback and Improvement

### Collection Methods
- Regular community surveys
- Feedback forms and suggestion boxes
- Town hall meetings
- One-on-one interviews

### Implementation Process
- Analysis of feedback data
- Prioritization of improvements
- Development of action plans
- Communication of changes

These Community Guidelines are living documents that evolve with our community. We encourage all members to help create and maintain a positive, productive environment where everyone can thrive.

For questions about these guidelines or to report issues, please contact community@synthflow.ai.
